wikipedia_page.main:
Anna Maria Bennett (ca. 1750 – 12 February 1808) was a Welsh novelist who wrote in English.  Some sources give her name as Agnes Maria Bennett. She had two children, and she taught her daughter to act. She became a noted stage actor. Her best-known work is the epistolary novel Agnes de-Courci (1789).
She worked as the housekeeper of Thomas Pye, and was also her employer's mistress. They had two illegitimate children. Their most notable child was the actress Harriet Pye Esten.
